column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: gricelda, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: this medication does not work for long term.  i have 2  lower back herniated disks that have become very painful from over use.  it helps for a short while but if you add physical therapy to your routine it works better.  i take it at night and works great for a good nights sleep.

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: SPC, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: LOVE this stuff. Once I take it, and lay down, I am OUT. It allows me to sleep with out waking up from pain. I can function the next day, unlike previous muscle relaxers.

column2: hljimo, 75 or over Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
ViciousVamp , 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I took this drug before I was diagnosed with fibromyalgia and it was 10mg and already having a high tolerance for pain meds along with muscle relaxers I didn't think this med would work. Before I got the scrip I took 10mg of vicodin which doesn't help my pain much any I took two 10mg tabs of flexeril and boy that wasn't a good idea my boyfriend found me in the freezer section of the store we were at talking to a pink elephant I saw lol. Definately not a good idea to take it with narcotic pain medicines I'd recommend waiting a couple hours. This medicine helped somewhat but I was still in pain and I was pretty much zombiefied for 6 to 8 hours after I woke up.

column9: An hour after taking the first pill, 7.5mg, I could walk with little or no pain.  It did not make me sleepy, but did make me feel disoriented for about 16 hours.
